title: After playing new Vlad....
body:
...I've decided he's weaker at all stages of the game. Significantly weaker, and he was already in a terrible state before. 

The burst you do its relatively equal if you happen to have empower Q and get a fully charged E. The DPS took a HUGE nerf. 

The sustain from empowered Q hardly matters because its so clunky that you can never, ever get it off in a situation where it would be useful.

The ult heal feels insanely weak for how much damage they took out of it. 

They even nerfed his W damage for absolutely no reason. At least make it scale with rank back up to 15%.

Despite being 'the sustain guy', he cannot even fathom fighting anyone with lifesteal now. His DPS and burst are now both far too weak to even hope to go toe to toe with them.


This Vlad reworks' numbers suck. He needs huge buffs. One of them could be taking the healing delay off Q. Its impossible to get clutch heals because of the delay, especially since using W makes you avoid the Q heal, and that's where a huge portion of his issues come from.

replies.body: Hey, I've noticed something you've all been saying that Riot themselves have stated - these are merely numbers problems, not kit problems. They stated that they'll be monitoring the mages on live and tweaking numbers and ratios as they see fit. In a game like this, it's much better to underpower something when you massive reworks and then gradually bring it up than to drop 15 OP kits in the game and watch all hell break loose.

A lot of issues are numbers right now, but there are mechanical issues that make him nearly unplayable as well. 

* His Q has a much larger delay that affects movement, healing, and damage. This is huge considering how much more reliant he is on its use now (ironically). 

* Q gets canceled by W. Heal particle gets canceled if you wait until after Q casts to W. 

* W gets canceled by E. Can't cast E during W. 

* W now has a longer delay before untargetability. Untargetability now ends sooner, but you are self-silenced for that remaining duration still. Combined with new Q delay, its nearly a full second that you're vulnerable, and often get crit 2 times by the ADC and die before you can use empowered Q out of W. 

* I seem to be dying during W quite often, despite facing minimal DoT damage so far. Hell, ignites aren't even on me the large majority of the time before I pool. 

* E's self-slow is entirely counter-intuitive. I'd rather them remove the self-slow and enemy slow on full charge. They just cancel each other out and accomplish nothing after Rylai's.

I agree. I just played several games with him. 

I did fine in lane without dying but when it came to team fights, the damage and DPS nerf was real. Q did pretty much no damage unless it was empowered (and there's too little control over when its empowered, the window is too short to use). 

E is SUPER hard to aim. People would just walk away whenever I have the blood balloons up and if I snap-shot fired it, it does SHIT damage. 

He is now super awkward to play with very little pay off. It used to be the case that you would simply kite in team fights with Qs and snapshot Es (both were highly reliable) with tons of damage, the only handicap being range and lack of cc. The old Ult worked very well with that because you could fire it and just keep kiting.

Now its SUPER not fluid because E takes time to charge (people just walk away). If I Ult I can't follow up with any kind of real power because Q won't be empowered and E takes time to charge. It takes way too much work to play him for far too little pay off.
Yes, please tell us more about how Vlad is and what he needs after your extensive gameplay with the rework.

He needed things even before the rework that the rework didn't address, and actually made worse. 

Considering his damage and sustain both took a huge hit overall, yes, he does need more. Especially since he can't access the 'best-case' sustain due to how clunky his Q is, and the lack of synergy with his W. 

The fact that W is still far, far better for clutch saves proves there are innate problems with his Q, considering how much power was loaded into the Blood Rush passive.

The Q heal is only useful for 1v1s and the occasional 2v1 that you can actually kite. 


Keep in mind...how many Qs was Vlad actually able to get off in teamfights prior to the rework before the fight was already decided and outside of Vlad's hands? Considering CD was nerfed, he gets off even fewer still, and only half as many actually do something.

My personal thoughts on Vlad from someone who purchased him as his second character when starting League years ago, and played him moderately ever since, sometimes in ranked...

Passive: I actually like the shift towards health. Vlad being more of an AP Juggernaut is an interesting concept that really fits his theme and the class mechanics. Low mobility, huge DPS and tankyness/sustain.

Q: Currently the Blood Rush passive has far too short of a window for Vlad to do anything but use it immediately in lane after the second charge. There's no way to set this up for a gank or teamfight in any fashion, which means that Vlad never gets to position himself at an advantage even when he gets the drop on someone. That feels really bad. Either the window needs to last longer or the unempowered Q needs a bit more sustain/damage to let Vlad trade.

W: Virtually unchanged and it wasn't Vlad's biggest damage dealing ability by a long shot, so why the numbers got nerfed is a bit beyond me but falls under the "pretty inconsequential" category for me since the move was used either as an escape tool or a means to dodge an opponent's nuke/cc.

E: Considering the huge telegraphed windup on E, and the fact that it can be blocked by units, and it's relatively short range I don't understand why he needs to be slowed while channeling it. There's already a lot of counterplay existing in that skill - the self-slow just makes Vlad feel clunkier than he should.

R: Vlad should get an immediate payoff for using this ultimate since the 10% damage increase is extremely hard to actually use given that the window of opportunity for an optimal use of both Q and E have been narrowed significantly. Getting Blood Rush and an fully charged E while this ult is active to get a fair trade feels restrictive.

They're pushing him in the right direction but he's severely lacking in power and his windows of power are far too telegraphed. Given that he has no execute, no hard cc, no real tools beyond his sustain and power to assert lane dominance he really needs to shine in these departments, which he isn't.

Most of that seem number problems though, which are to be expected after such an update. For now the most important thing is that the kit changes work out positively, after that they can start tweaking the numbers.

It was sarcasm. I'm saying with so little experience of the new Vlad, you aren't qualified to start listing off what he needs. Not just yet.

You only need about 4 games with him to see the repeated, glaring problems with both the mechanics of his kit and the scaling therein. He's even more vulnerable now to grievous wounds and MR, given his damage output nerf and his self healing nerf. Where before you could potentially skip Spirit Visage and build Vlad more damaging, now you HAVE to have it to survive, further reducing your already poor sustained damage. Vlad COULD have survived this if spell vamp hadn't ALSO been removed. The combination of the direct nerf plus the itemization nuke results in Vlad being less effective in a push than a Banner'd Siege Minion. I mean, sure, it's a lot more effective than a normal siege minion... but it's not as effective as a champ.

I just played my first game with the new vlad and I found him to be completely underwhelming. His Q dmg and heal feel extremely weak, his E feels unreliable and pretty weak unless held for the entire duration which then takes away his ability to kite because it slows him, and then his pool does barely enough dmg to even use it offensively. His crimson rush duration is so short that if you ever miss using one of them than you can't use your E or else you're going to die. The fact that to push a lane you must essentially kill yourself and hope to have a crimson rush Q available to heal back while having a target around is insane. Overall I felt like i didnt even recognize one of my favorite champs who I've played hundreds of games with.

And nothing of value was lost.

Sorry, I just hate Vlad as a champion concept so very, very much.  Pre based lord and savior Riot 6.9 nerfs he was the most unfun and uninteractive thing in the world to lane against or deal with if he was ahead.  When feedback started coming in that he's terrible now I legit busted open a $300 bottle of scotch and drank it slowly as I sat by a fireplace, laughing, for probably four hours.  I had to get medical assistance when I threw my back out cackling when I saw that a lot of people say Swain came in weaker as well.

Now if we can just get Garen, Zed, Katarina, and Yi "deleted" too...

In all seriousness, though, new Vlad was made to be way less faceroll suffocating, but he does seem really jank even just on paper and that's just bad for everybody.  I hope they tune him so people who actually liked the idea of his niche can play him with success, and that's about as far removed as I can be from bias given his rework.

Now if you'll excuse me, I have a "Vlad is dead" holiday to get ratified in the U.S.  {{champion:8}}

Ya, as much as I hate fighting Vlad, there are people that actually liked playing as him.  I think they're nuts, but they have every right to be mad about his current state and for their sake I hope that he gets "fixt" as it were.

Just, you know, in a way that makes him fun to play, and not anti-fun to play against.

Heh, he is one of the most accessible and friendly mages of the bunch to fight against.

He doesn't have much range, means you can actually brawl him in a duel, which is a lot more enjoyable than playing Dance Dance Revolution on your own with skillshots from 1K+ range without being able to fight back; He doesn't have any CC either unless you count his escape and again it's melee he has to commit to use it and even then it's only a slow which means you never lose control of your character at any point which is a lot more enjoyable than being stunned/crowdcontrol to death without being able to fight back/react, and he doesn't have much burst either, which means you can always brawl and fight back and not risk being deleted before anything even happens.

And to top it off, his sustain is nothing special given how popular and mainstream lifesteal is.

Compare that to the abominations of Anivia and the like and you want to cry.

I was 11/0/4 that game by the way, and the only reason I got that way was their mid laner was late to game and I was a complete jerk about diving him. I don't like his ult change either, feels so weak now (even when you manage to ult 5 people). 

I don't won't to be lying, but he used to not recieve healing from his Q if you turned untargetable (pool or zhonya's), is the ult healing treated the same? I didn't really notice, but if so, they should probably change it along with his Q.

Other than these little complaints, I find Vladimir rework to be a success.

Vlad's rework did nothing to fix his previous prohibitive issues while adding new ones. 

I'd hardly call anyone with a .5 second 16 MS buff a on a buff they're now extremely reliant on a 'success'. That's probably only there so Riot can scream "POWERBUDGET" and keep him artificially weaker. Same with the E slow, which they could remove along with the self-slow, as they cancel out. Same with the Q delay nerf. Same with the W delay nerf, both on start-up and exit. Hell, that's the only reason they added the heal on his ult...so they can scream LOOK AT THAT SUSTAIN, when his effective sustain and damage are garbage now.

The important thing to understand about the reworks is that they look more at the gameplay side of the champion's kit rather than the balance side of it.

If Riot tried to balance Vladimir (or any of the mages for that matter), we might not have gotten 6.9 in an efficient time frame, and we might have gotten a lot more balance problems coming from the update than that of the juggernaut and marksmen update combined, and both of those updates were busted as hell.

The important thing to get from these kinds of updates is to see if the champion plays better, not that the champion got buffed. Taking away the numbers, how do you feel about his kit now from a gameplay standpoint?

I think E shouldn't slow the user at full charge (it has enough counterplay with the charge time, ANYONE can see you raising a blood balloon and back off). They should also remove the Slow from E in exchange for more damage. The Slow is useless anyways because most Vlads are going to rush Rylais. I would also consider making E Snap-shot fire but still block-able (allowing counterplay) and FIX the health cost and damage at a point between the max damage and min damage as I think it being snap-shot fire would be way more useful to Vlad players for their DPS then the current clumsy charging. I know it takes away some decision-making but right now there's too little oppertunities to use the full cast anyways. 

Crimson Rush needs a longer timer for the buff since you can't control WHEN it is up. Think about it... am I going to go... ''Okay, there's a team fight, let's use the First Q on a target, when I get to the fight I'll use my Second Q on a nearby minion and then position myself so that  ~SEVEN/FIVE seconds later I'll be near an enemy to hit him with Empowered Q? It's just not REALISTIC and you just can't set up plays like that. You can't predict where you will be or where your enemy will be that many seconds later.

Also... R should get MORE damage amp than pre-rework Vlad (I'd say 15%) and we can do away with the Heal. It's entirely useless, you don't heal if you are in Zhonya or Pool mode anyways. What we need is MORE damage.

His laning is actually quite strong. Just this morning  I held my own against Gold Zeds and Talons in the Mid lane. I didn't die at all and kept up in CS and my sustain and tactical play frustrated them so they went roaming. 

But then laning phase ended... 

and my DPS in team fights SUCKED compared to old Vlad... like horribly bad...
Exactly. I'd much rather go back to getting shit on in lane, and then having a godly late game.

I think the healing delay on his Q is problematic like you've stated, but managing the empowered charge makes him more interesting. 

The place he *really* feels lacking right now is his E. It costs as much as 10% MAX health (not even current health) yet has a pathetic base damage of only 140 at rank 5. I would be MUCH happier with the ability if it scaled from 5-10% max health cost but had a base damage and ratio about 50% higher (increasing to double damage after the charge up).

Honestly, I'd even prefer they cut the self slow and slow on release for the max charge. It is redundant and empty power considering his W already slows and they don't stack. Heck they could even make his W slow scale with ranks in E if they wanted, but trade the false power of a conditional slow for some reliable DPS/Burst.

The problem with the new vlad is....

His kit is super loaded to counter play it with no skill ceiling or play making ability for the actual vlad.

His Q has an extremely short window where basicly the only way you get it off is if you ensure minions are going to be up. The healing on it is laughable either way.

His E has innate counter play because you have to charge it forever. This was not enough for Riot. Now you have to charge it, and line it up because it can be blocked as well. This was also not enough for riot so it slows you down when fully charged.

His ult is a joke in it's current state. The hit box is insanely small ensuring you will never hit more than one or two targets.
